Cytometry 71A: 1034-1038. https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3463982/pdf/10616_2004_Article_5113481.pdf Coulter Epics Elite (1993) WHY? – A comparison to conventional techniques • Conventional cytometry: • Labour intensive - slow • Leads to operator fatigue • Measures a small number of cells • Qualitative or semi-quantitative • Subjective • Biochemical techniques: • Measure populations rather than single cells • Differences and distribution information lost Advantages of flow cytometry • Analyses single cells - heterogeneity • Rapid – typically 100+ cells/second – some specialised instruments can measure 10,000 cells/sec. • Quantitative • Multiparametric • Allows physical separation of cells with selected characteristics - FACS Microbiology • Absolute or relative counting • Determination of physiological state • More information than plate counts • Quicker than plate counts Determination of microbial viability Dye exclusion – e.g. Propidium Iodide PI PI R R R R RR R R Dye uptake – e.g. Rhodamine 123 FDA FDA F Metabolic activity – e.g. Fluorescein diacetate Propidiu m iodide exclusion 10 0 10 1 102 10 3 10 4 500 100 200 300 400 PI FluorescenceEventsPI+ve (dead) PI-ve (live) 10 0 10 1 102 10 3 10 4 500 100 200 300 400 PI FluorescenceEventsPI+ve (dead) PI-ve (live) PI PI PI PI PI PI Fluorescence-activated cell sorting 1 2 3 Flow imaging http://www.amnis.com •Cytometry for Life •http://www.cytometryforlife.org/ •HIV monitoring and remote location health support in Africa
